intro: Cryptantha kelseyana, commonly known as Kelsey's bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss. Cryptantha kelseyana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
